page.title: 15Forestry Commission
page.content: The Forestry Commission owns two areas of woodland near Bassenthwaite,forming a major industry in this area 1.Park Wood-135 acres bought in 1964. 2.Dodd Wood-750 acres bought in 1948. Types of Trees grown-1.Conifers:_ Larch, Douglas Fir, Sitka Spruce. 2.Hardwood:- e.g. Oak, Ash, Birch Management- Before they are planted the foliage is dipped in fluid called gammac oil to prevent disease. After they are planted they are left to grow for about twenty years.Then they are felled and sent to the various mills. Problems- The main threats are Insects, Beetles, Canker and Butt Rot. Deer eat the tops of young trees. Uses- Most of the trees go to make pulp wood. The rest go to make posts and rails.
